comments:
Adoptor:IBM
Need the fix in 1.5:

We have a healess app that uses WTP 1.5 common archive api to import
and ejb jar file or ear file.  This is currently broken due the deprecated
api.  There are several properties and classes that are deprecated.
Yet although they compile fine it failes at runtime. with this
exception

y: java.lang.RuntimeException: Property not located:IJ2EEModuleImportDataModelProperties.ADD_TO_EAR
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.DataModelImpl.checkValidPropertyName(DataModelImpl.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.DataModelImpl.getOwningDataModel(DataModelImpl.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.DataModelImpl.setProperty(DataModelImpl.java:172)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.DataModelImpl.setBooleanProperty(DataModelImpl.java:198)
	at com.ibm.etools.ejbdeploy.batch.plugin.BatchExtension.importEJBJarModule(BatchExtension.java:827)

At the same time there is no correct api properties we can switch to all fail.


EJBComponentImportDataModelProvider.ADD_TO_EAR and
IJ2EEComponentCreationDataModelProperties.CREATE_DEFAULT_FILES
are the ones currently broken.

We might discover more but cannot go any  further until these 2 are fixed.

Tried J2EEFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.ADD_TO_EAR
 suggested by WTP jst team and it fails with facet install errors.

There is no suggestion for IJ2EEComponentCreationDataModelProperties.CREATE_DEFAULT_FILES

This is workng as designed and will not be modified as you request.  If you take a look at the various Component import data models, you will notice they all have nested models used for project creation which can be accessed via IJ2EEComponentImportDataModelProperties.NESTED_MODEL_J2EE_COMPONENT_CREATION

Once you have the nested project creation model, you will notice that the backing provider supports IFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.

From the nested model project creation data model get the IFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.FACET_DM_MAP property which is an instanceof IFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.FacetDataModelMap

From that map you can get the facet data model responsible for creating the J2EE portion of the project, by passing in the facet id to getFacetDataModel(String facetID).

For example, you might pass in IModuleConstants.JST_EJB_MODULE if you  are importing an EJB-jar.

The model you get back from that map is what you need to set IJ2EEModuleFacetInstallDataModelProperties.ADD_TO_EAR (dont use the ADD_TO_EAR you mention below)

As far as CREATE_DEFAULT_FILES, there is no replacement, if you need a replacement, please open another defect to the effect of: when i import an ejb jar, default files shouldn't be created because they are immediatly going to be overwritten by the import.

Jason,

I tried the changes you gave me:

((IFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.FacetDataModelMap )dataModel.getNestedDataModel(NESTED_MODEL_J2EE_COMPONENT_CREATION).getProperty()IFacetProjectCreationDataModelProperties.FACET_DM_MAP)).getFacetDataModel("jst.ejb").setBooleanProperty(
IJ2EEModuleFacetInstallDataModelProperties.ADD_TO_EAR, true)

with getNestedModel() instead of getNestedDataModel() (this method does not
exist on the IDataModel interface) and things seem to be better but I then run into:
